intro: Acrostichum oligodictyon, commonly known as the narrow-leaf brake, is a member of the fern family (Polypodiaceae). It is a terrestrial fern that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. The plant has slender, strap-like leaves that are dark green and often have a slightly serrated edge. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are clustered on the underside of the fronds. Acrostichum oligodictyon plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
